derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin auctio(n-) 'increase, auction', from the verb augere 'to increase'

entry.def: An auction is a public sale where goods are sold to the person who offers the highest price.

example.ex: Lord Salisbury bought the picture at auction in London some years ago...
example.tran: 几年前，索尔兹伯里勋爵在伦敦拍得了这幅画。

example.ex: Britain's two main auction houses, Sotheby's and Christies, have been involved in valuing the works.
example.tran: 英国最大的两家拍卖行，苏富比和佳士得参与了对这些作品的估价。

entry.def: If something is auctioned, it is sold in an auction.

example.ex: Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week...
example.tran: 下周法国画家让·科克托的8幅作品将被拍卖。

example.ex: The airline plans to auction its international routes to former competitors...
example.tran: 这家航空公司打算把他们的国际线路拍卖给以前的竞争对手。

means.word_mean: 1. a variety of bridge in which tricks made in excess of the contract are scored toward game; now generally superseded by contract bridge
2. the public sale of something to the highest bidder

stems_affixes.word_buile: aug增加+ury→[使事态扩大]的预兆
aug增加+ust→八月为水果等丰收的结节
auct=aug增加+ion动作或状态→[价钱]扩大→拍卖
aug增加+ment→v.[使]增大,增加,增长,扩张

sentences.en: We bought these items at an auction.
sentences.cn: 这些物件是我们在一次拍卖时买的。

sentences.en: They've put the contents of their house up for auction.
sentences.cn: 他们把房子里的东西全都拿去拍卖了。

sentences.en: He auctioned all his old furniture.
sentences.cn: 他把所有的旧家具都拍卖掉了。
